acm-certificate-with-close-expiration-da.description: ACM Certificate Expiring in Less Than 7 Days
acm-certificate-with-close-expiration-da.rationale: Ensure that certificates which are in use are not about to expire.

acm-certificate-with-transparency-loggin.description: ACM Certificate with Transparency Logging Set to Disabled
acm-certificate-with-transparency-loggin.rationale: Disabling Transparency Logging may result in browsers not trusting your certificate. As of April 30 2018, Google Chrome no longer trusts public SSL/TLS certificates that are not recorded in a certificate transparency log. Transparency Logging should be enabled as a best practice.

cloudformation-stack-with-role.rationale: Passing a role to CloudFormation stacks may result in privilege escalation because IAM users with privileges within the CloudFormation scope implicitly inherit the stack's role's permissions. Consequently, it should be ensured that the IAM privileges assigned to the stack's role follow the principle of least privilege.

cloudfront-distribution-cleartext-origin.description: Content Distribution with Clear-Text Origin TLS Policy
cloudfront-distribution-cleartext-origin.rationale: Distributing content between AWS CloudFront distributions and their custom origins over clear-text HTTP, without using AWS encryption solutions, can potentially expose sensitive data.

cloudfront-distribution-insecure-origin.description: Content Distribution with Insecure Origin TLS Policy
cloudfront-distribution-insecure-origin.rationale: Distributing content between AWS CloudFront distributions and their custom origins over HTTPS using older SSL/TLS protocols can potentially expose sensitive data.

cloudfront-distribution-insufficient-vie.description: Content Distribution with Insufficient Viewer Security Policy
cloudfront-distribution-insufficient-vie.rationale: Distributing content between AWS CloudFront distributions and their custom origins without the use of a valid certificate, can potentially expose sensitive data.

cloudtrail-duplicated-global-services-lo.rationale: Global service logging is enabled in multiple Trails. While this does not jeopardize the security of the environment, duplicated entries in logs increase the difficulty to investigate potential incidents.

cloudtrail-no-cloudwatch-integration.description: Trail Is Not Integrated with CloudWatch
cloudtrail-no-cloudwatch-integration.rationale: The lack of integration with CloudWatch hinders real-time and historic activity logging as well as not allowing the configuration of alarms and notifications for anomalous account activity.
cloudtrail-no-cloudwatch-integration.remediation: Configure each Trail to have a CloudWatch Logs group attached

cloudtrail-no-data-logging.rationale:
CloudTrail Data Logging is not configured, which means that S3 access and Lambda invocations are not logged.

Note: S3 bucket logging can be used in place of CloudTrail data events for S3. If that is the case, logs for Lambda invocations may still be missing.

cloudtrail-no-encryption-with-kms.description: CloudTrail Logs Not Encrypted with KMS Customer Master Keys (CMKs)
cloudtrail-no-encryption-with-kms.rationale: Not encrypting CloudTrail logs with SSE-KMS affects the confidentiality of the log data.
cloudtrail-no-encryption-with-kms.remediation: Ensure each Trail is encrypted with a KMS key

cloudtrail-no-global-services-logging.rationale: API activity for global services such as IAM and STS is not logged. Investigation of incidents will be incomplete due to the lack of information.

cloudtrail-no-log-file-validation.rationale: The lack of log file validation prevents from verifying the integrity of CloudTrail log files.
cloudtrail-no-log-file-validation.remediation: Ensure that each Trail has Enable log file validation set to Yes

cloudtrail-no-logging.rationale: Logging is disabled for a given Trail. Depending on the configuration, logs for important API activity may be missing.
cloudtrail-no-logging.remediation: Configure all Trails to enable Logging, set Apply trail to all regions and ensure that Read/Write Events are set to ALL

cloudtrail-not-configured.rationale: CloudTrail is not configured, which means that API activity is not logged.

cloudtrail-partial-data-logging.description: Data Logging Configuration Not Covering All Resources
cloudtrail-partial-data-logging.rationale:
CloudTrail Data Logging is not configured to cover all S3 or Lambda resources, which means that all S3 access and Lambda invocations are not logged.

Note: S3 bucket logging can be used in place of CloudTrail data events for S3. If that is the case, logs for Lambda invocations may still be missing.

cloudwatch-alarm-without-actions.rationale: Each alarm should have at least one action

config-recorder-not-configured.rationale: No AWS Config recorders are configured, which means that changes in AWS resource configuration are not logged. This hinders security analysis, resource change tracking and compliance auditing.
config-recorder-not-configured.remediation: Enable AWS Config in all regions, define the resources you want to record in each region and include global resources (IAM resources)

ec2-ami-public.rationale: AMIs should never intentionally be made public. If they need to be shared this can be done with specific AWS accounts.

ec2-default-security-group-in-use.rationale: The use of default security groups can indicate a lack of intentional enforcement of the principle of least privilege. Use custom security groups to ensure you are properly minimizing privilege and access.
ec2-default-security-group-in-use.remediation: Ensure resources are not within default security groups. Instead, create a custom security group tailored to each resource needs.

ec2-default-security-group-with-rules.description: Non-empty Rulesets for Default Security Groups
ec2-default-security-group-with-rules.rationale: The default security group created in each VPC comes with rules allowing all inbound traffic from instances assigned to the same security group, as well as all outbound traffic. In order to improve system hardening, you should remove all rules from the default security groups so that they restricts all traffic. Should an instance be created without custom security groups, it will inherit the default security group and be unable to communicate with other instances within the VPC until the required custom security groups are assigned.
ec2-default-security-group-with-rules.remediation: Ensure the default security group of every VPC restricts all traffic

ec2-ebs-snapshot-public.rationale: Snapshots should never be public, as this risks exposing sensitive data.

ec2-ebs-volume-not-encrypted.rationale: Enabling encryption of EBS volumes ensures that data is encrypted both at-rest and in-transit (between an instance and its attached EBS storage).

ec2-instance-with-user-data-secrets.description: Potential Secret in Instance User Data
ec2-instance-with-user-data-secrets.rationale: It was detected that the EC2 instance was configured with user data, which could potentially include secrets. Although user data can only be accessed from within the instance itself, the data is not protected by cryptographic methods. Anyone who can access the instance can view its metadata. It should therefore be ensured that sensitive data, such as passwords and SSH keys, are not stored as user data.

ec2-security-group-opens-DNS-port-to-all.description: Security Group Opens DNS Port to All
ec2-security-group-opens-DNS-port-to-all.rationale: The security group was found to be exposing a well-known port to all source addresses. Well-known ports are commonly probed by automated scanning tools, and could be an indicator of sensitive services exposed to Internet. If such services need to be exposed, a restriction on the source address could help to reduce the attack surface of the infrastructure.
ec2-security-group-opens-DNS-port-to-all.remediation: Remove the inbound rules that expose open ports

ec2-security-group-opens-MongoDB-port-to.description: Security Group Opens MongoDB Port to All
ec2-security-group-opens-MongoDB-port-to.rationale: The security group was found to be exposing a well-known port to all source addresses. Well-known ports are commonly probed by automated scanning tools, and could be an indicator of sensitive services exposed to Internet. If such services need to be exposed, a restriction on the source address could help to reduce the attack surface of the infrastructure.
ec2-security-group-opens-MongoDB-port-to.remediation: Remove the inbound rules that expose open ports

ec2-security-group-opens-MsSQL-port-to-a.description: Security Group Opens MsSQL Port to All
ec2-security-group-opens-MsSQL-port-to-a.rationale: The security group was found to be exposing a well-known port to all source addresses. Well-known ports are commonly probed by automated scanning tools, and could be an indicator of sensitive services exposed to Internet. If such services need to be exposed, a restriction on the source address could help to reduce the attack surface of the infrastructure.
ec2-security-group-opens-MsSQL-port-to-a.remediation: Remove the inbound rules that expose open ports

ec2-security-group-opens-MySQL-port-to-a.description: Security Group Opens MySQL Port to All
ec2-security-group-opens-MySQL-port-to-a.rationale: The security group was found to be exposing a well-known port to all source addresses. Well-known ports are commonly probed by automated scanning tools, and could be an indicator of sensitive services exposed to Internet. If such services need to be exposed, a restriction on the source address could help to reduce the attack surface of the infrastructure.
ec2-security-group-opens-MySQL-port-to-a.remediation: Remove the inbound rules that expose open ports

ec2-security-group-opens-NFS-port-to-all.description: Security Group Opens NFS Port to All
ec2-security-group-opens-NFS-port-to-all.rationale: The security group was found to be exposing a well-known port to all source addresses. Well-known ports are commonly probed by automated scanning tools, and could be an indicator of sensitive services exposed to Internet. If such services need to be exposed, a restriction on the source address could help to reduce the attack surface of the infrastructure.
ec2-security-group-opens-NFS-port-to-all.remediation: Remove the inbound rules that expose open ports

ec2-security-group-opens-Oracle DB-port-.description: Security Group Opens Oracle DB Port to All
ec2-security-group-opens-Oracle DB-port-.rationale: The security group was found to be exposing a well-known port to all source addresses. Well-known ports are commonly probed by automated scanning tools, and could be an indicator of sensitive services exposed to Internet. If such services need to be exposed, a restriction on the source address could help to reduce the attack surface of the infrastructure.
ec2-security-group-opens-Oracle DB-port-.remediation: Remove the inbound rules that expose open ports

ec2-security-group-opens-PostgreSQL-port.description: Security Group Opens PostgreSQL Port to All
ec2-security-group-opens-PostgreSQL-port.rationale: The security group was found to be exposing a well-known port to all source addresses. Well-known ports are commonly probed by automated scanning tools, and could be an indicator of sensitive services exposed to Internet. If such services need to be exposed, a restriction on the source address could help to reduce the attack surface of the infrastructure.
ec2-security-group-opens-PostgreSQL-port.remediation: Remove the inbound rules that expose open ports

ec2-security-group-opens-RDP-port-to-all.description: Security Group Opens RDP Port to All
ec2-security-group-opens-RDP-port-to-all.rationale: The security group was found to be exposing a well-known port to all source addresses. Well-known ports are commonly probed by automated scanning tools, and could be an indicator of sensitive services exposed to Internet. If such services need to be exposed, a restriction on the source address could help to reduce the attack surface of the infrastructure.
ec2-security-group-opens-RDP-port-to-all.remediation: Remove the inbound rules that expose open ports

ec2-security-group-opens-SMTP-port-to-al.description: Security Group Opens SMTP Port to All
ec2-security-group-opens-SMTP-port-to-al.rationale: The security group was found to be exposing a well-known port to all source addresses. Well-known ports are commonly probed by automated scanning tools, and could be an indicator of sensitive services exposed to Internet. If such services need to be exposed, a restriction on the source address could help to reduce the attack surface of the infrastructure.
ec2-security-group-opens-SMTP-port-to-al.remediation: Remove the inbound rules that expose open ports

ec2-security-group-opens-SSH-port-to-all.description: Security Group Opens SSH Port to All
ec2-security-group-opens-SSH-port-to-all.rationale: The security group was found to be exposing a well-known port to all source addresses. Well-known ports are commonly probed by automated scanning tools, and could be an indicator of sensitive services exposed to Internet. If such services need to be exposed, a restriction on the source address could help to reduce the attack surface of the infrastructure.
ec2-security-group-opens-SSH-port-to-all.remediation: Remove the inbound rules that expose open ports

ec2-security-group-opens-TCP-port-to-all.description: Security Group Opens TCP Port to All
ec2-security-group-opens-TCP-port-to-all.rationale: The security group was found to be exposing a port to all source addresses. Ports are commonly probed by automated scanning tools, and could be an indicator of sensitive services exposed to Internet. If such services need to be exposed, a restriction on the source address could help to reduce the attack surface of the infrastructure.

ec2-security-group-opens-UDP-port-to-all.description: Security Group Opens UDP Port to All
ec2-security-group-opens-UDP-port-to-all.rationale: The security group was found to be exposing a port to all source addresses. Ports are commonly probed by automated scanning tools, and could be an indicator of sensitive services exposed to Internet. If such services need to be exposed, a restriction on the source address could help to reduce the attack surface of the infrastructure.

ec2-security-group-opens-all-ports.rationale: It was detected that all ports in the security group are open, which creates a wider attack surface for resources assigned to it. Open ports should be reduced to the minimum needed to correctly operate.

ec2-security-group-opens-all-ports-to-al.description: Security Group Opens All Ports to All
ec2-security-group-opens-all-ports-to-al.rationale: It was detected that all ports in the security group are open, and any source IP address could send traffic to these ports, which creates a wider attack surface for resources assigned to it. Open ports should be reduced to the minimum needed to correctly operate and, when possible, source address restrictions should be implemented.

ec2-security-group-opens-all-ports-to-se.description: Unrestricted Network Traffic within Security Group
ec2-security-group-opens-all-ports-to-se.rationale: This configuration goes against organizational policies.

ec2-security-group-opens-icmp-to-all.description: Security Group Allows ICMP Traffic to All
ec2-security-group-opens-icmp-to-all.rationale: ICMP traffic was allowed to the resources assigned to this security group without restriction of the source address. This could potentially be leveraged by an attacker trying to perform an attack or gather information about the deployed infrastructure.

ec2-security-group-opens-plaintext-port-.rationale: Ports associated with plaintext protocols have been found to be open in this security group. Plaintext protocols should be replaced with more secure alternatives, as the data in transit may be monitored and could, potentially, be subject to tampering.

Ports associated with plaintext protocols have been found to be open in this security group. Plaintext protocols should be replaced with more secure alternatives, as the data in transit may be monitored and could, potentially, be subject to tampering.

ec2-security-group-opens-port-range.rationale: It was found that the security group was using port ranges. Sometimes, ranges could include unintended ports that should not be exposed. As a result, when possible, explicit port lists should be used instead

ec2-security-group-whitelists-aws.rationale: The AWS IP ranges contain addresses which can be assigned to EC2 instances in any AWS account, as well as services which can be used to interact with any AWS account. Consequently, allowing these ranges potentially exposes your AWS account to external interactions.

ec2-unused-security-group.rationale: Non-default security groups were defined which were unused and may not be required. This being the case, their existence in the configuration increases the risk that they may be inappropriately assigned. The unused security groups should be reviewed and removed if no longer required.

elb-listener-allowing-cleartext.description: Load Balancer Allowing Clear Text (HTTP) Communication
elb-listener-allowing-cleartext.rationale: Use of a secure protocol (HTTPS or SSL) is best practice for encrypted communication. A load balancer without a listener using an encrypted protocol can be vulnerable to eavesdropping and man-in-the-middle attacks.

elb-no-access-logs.rationale: Elastic Load Balancing provides access logs that capture detailed information about requests sent to your load balancer. Each log contains information such as the time the request was received, the client's IP address, latencies, request paths, and server responses. You can use these access logs to analyze traffic patterns and identify security issues.

elb-older-ssl-policy.rationale:
Use of the latest TLS policies is best practice. The recommended predefined security policies are:
  • ELBSecurityPolicy-2016-08
  • ELBSecurityPolicy-FS-2018-06
  • ELBSecurityPolicy-TLS-1-1-2017-01
  • ELBSecurityPolicy-TLS-1-2-2017-01
  • ELBSecurityPolicy-TLS-1-2-Ext-2018-06
  • ELBSecurityPolicy-FS-1-1-2019-08
  • ELBSecurityPolicy-FS-1-2-2019-08
  • ELBSecurityPolicy-FS-1-2-Res-2019-08
  • ELBSecurityPolicy-FS-1-2-Res-2020-10

elbv2-http-request-smuggling.rationale: Dropping invalid header fields should be enabled in order to mitigate the risk of request smuggling attacks.

elbv2-listener-allowing-cleartext.description: Load Balancer Allowing Clear Text (HTTP) Communication
elbv2-listener-allowing-cleartext.rationale: Use of a secure protocol (HTTPS or SSL) is best practice for encrypted communication. A load balancer without a listener using an encrypted protocol can be vulnerable to eavesdropping and man-in-the-middle attacks.

elbv2-no-access-logs.rationale:
Elastic Load Balancing provides access logs that capture detailed information about requests sent to your load balancer. Each log contains information such as the time the request was received, the client's IP address, latencies, request paths, and server responses. You can use these access logs to analyze traffic patterns and identify security issues.

Note that for Network Load Balancers, access logs are created only if the load balancer has a TLS listener.

elbv2-no-deletion-protection.rationale: Enabling deletion protection on load balancers mitigates risks of accidental deletion.

elbv2-older-ssl-policy.rationale:
Use of the latest TLS policies is best practice. The recommended predefined security policies are:
  • ELBSecurityPolicy-2016-08
  • ELBSecurityPolicy-FS-2018-06
  • ELBSecurityPolicy-TLS-1-1-2017-01
  • ELBSecurityPolicy-TLS-1-2-2017-01
  • ELBSecurityPolicy-TLS-1-2-Ext-2018-06
  • ELBSecurityPolicy-FS-1-1-2019-08
  • ELBSecurityPolicy-FS-1-2-2019-08
  • ELBSecurityPolicy-FS-1-2-Res-2019-08
  • ELBSecurityPolicy-FS-1-2-Res-2020-10

kms-cmk-rotation-disabled.description: KMS Customer Master Keys (CMKs) with Rotation Disabled
kms-cmk-rotation-disabled.rationale:
Cryptographic best practices discourage extensive reuse of encryption keys. Consequently, Customer Master Keys (CMKs) should be rotated to prevent usage of compromised keys.

Note that AWS KMS supports optional automatic key rotation only for customer managed CMKs.
kms-cmk-rotation-disabled.remediation: For every KMS Customer Master Keys (CMKs), ensure that Rotate this key every year is enabled

rds-instance-backup-disabled.rationale: The backup retention period is a period of time between 0 and 35 days for which you can perform a point-in-time restore. Setting the backup retention period to 0 disables automated backups. Backups should be enabled to enable disaster recovery.

rds-instance-ca-certificate-deprecated.description: Deprecated Certificate Authority Assigned to RDS Instance
rds-instance-ca-certificate-deprecated.rationale: Amazon Web Services is deprecating the RDS Certificate Authority created in 2015 (rds-ca-2015). Any endpoints using TLS to protect RDS communications will fail after March 5th, 2020.

rds-instance-no-minor-upgrade.rationale: Auto Minor Version Upgrade is a feature that you can enable to have your database automatically upgraded when a new minor database engine version is available. Minor version upgrades often patch security vulnerabilities and fix bugs, and therefor should be applied.

rds-instance-publicly-accessible.rationale: Instances should not be publicly accessible as this risks exposing sensitive data.

rds-instance-short-backup-retention-peri.rationale:
The backup retention period is a period of time between 0 and 35 days for which you can perform a point-in-time restore. Setting the backup retention period to 0 disables automated backups.

It is recommended that the retention period is set to at least 30 days. Having a short retention period will impact how far back in time the database can be restored to, and may affect integrity and availability of data.

rds-instance-single-az.rationale: In case of failure, with a single-AZ deployment configuration, should an availability zone specific database failure occur, Amazon RDS can not automatically fail over to the standby availability zone.

rds-security-group-allows-all.description: Security Group Allows All IP Addresses
rds-security-group-allows-all.rationale: The security group allows access to RDS instances from any source address, which creates a wider attack surface for resources assigned to it. Source address restrictions should be implemented

rds-snapshot-public.rationale: Snapshots should never be public, as this risks exposing sensitive data.

redshift-cluster-no-version-upgrade.rationale: Version upgrade is necessary to ensure major version upgrades will be applied automatically to the cluster within the maintenance window.

redshift-cluster-publicly-accessible.rationale: Redshift clusters should never be public, as this increases the risk of exposing sensitive data. Public accessibility means that other AWS users can access your cluster and the data stored in it.

redshift-parameter-group-logging-disable.rationale:
Audit logging is not enabled by default in Amazon Redshift. A lack of user activity logging could impede the ability to investigate issues involving misuse, malicious access or performance.

Note that this rule will only flag non-default parameter groups, as default parameter groups cannot be modified. It is recommended to use custom groups and configure them according to security best practice.

redshift-parameter-group-ssl-not-require.rationale:
Parameter groups associated with Redshift clusters should have the "require_ssl" parameter enabled, to ensure that data in transit is encrypted.

Note that this rule will only flag non-default parameter groups, as default parameter groups cannot be modified. It is recommended to use custom groups and configure them according to security best practice.

redshift-security-group-whitelists-all.rationale: The security group allows access to Redshift instances from any source address, which creates a wider attack surface for resources assigned to it. Source address restrictions should be implemented

route53-domain-no-autorenew.description: Automatic Renewal Not Set for Domain
route53-domain-no-autorenew.rationale: Enable automatic renewal to remove the risk of losing control over your domain names.

route53-domain-no-transferlock.rationale: A domain lock prevents someone from transferring your domain to another registrar without your permission.

route53-domain-transferlock-not-authoriz.description: Domain Transfer Lock Not Supported by TLD
route53-domain-transferlock-not-authoriz.rationale: A domain lock prevents someone from transferring your domain to another registrar without your permission. Your domain's TLD does not support this feature.

s3-bucket-AllUsers-read.rationale: An S3 bucket has been found that was accessible for AllUsers. If sensitive information is stored in this bucket, it could be at risk of being accessed by potential attackers.

s3-bucket-AllUsers-read_acp.rationale: An S3 bucket has been found that was accessible for AllUsers. If sensitive information is stored in this bucket, it could be at risk of being accessed by potential attackers.

s3-bucket-AllUsers-write.rationale: An S3 bucket has been found that was accessible for AllUsers. If sensitive information is stored in this bucket, it could be at risk of being accessed by potential attackers.

s3-bucket-AllUsers-write_acp.rationale: An S3 bucket has been found that was accessible for AllUsers. If sensitive information is stored in this bucket, it could be at risk of being accessed by potential attackers.

s3-bucket-AuthenticatedUsers-read.rationale: An S3 bucket has been found that was accessible for AuthenticatedUsers. If sensitive information is stored in this bucket, it could be at risk of being accessed by potential attackers.

s3-bucket-AuthenticatedUsers-read_acp.rationale: An S3 bucket has been found that was accessible for AuthenticatedUsers. If sensitive information is stored in this bucket, it could be at risk of being accessed by potential attackers.

s3-bucket-AuthenticatedUsers-write.rationale: An S3 bucket has been found that was accessible for AuthenticatedUsers. If sensitive information is stored in this bucket, it could be at risk of being accessed by potential attackers.

s3-bucket-AuthenticatedUsers-write_acp.rationale: An S3 bucket has been found that was accessible for AuthenticatedUsers. If sensitive information is stored in this bucket, it could be at risk of being accessed by potential attackers.

s3-bucket-allowing-cleartext.rationale: If HTTPS is not enforced on the bucket policy, communication between clients and S3 buckets can use unencrypted HTTP. As a result, sensitive information could be transmitted in clear text over the network|Internet.

s3-bucket-no-default-encryption.rationale: Amazon S3 default encryption provides a way to set the default encryption behavior for an S3 bucket. This will ensure data-at-rest is encrypted

s3-bucket-no-logging.rationale:
Server access logging provides detailed records of the requests that are made to a bucket. Server access logs can assist you in security and access audits, help you learn about your customer base, and understand your Amazon S3 bill.

Note: CloudTrail data events can be used in place of S3 bucket logging. If that is the case, this finding can be considered a false positive.
s3-bucket-no-logging.remediation: Ensure that S3 buckets have Logging enabled

s3-bucket-no-mfa-delete.rationale: Enable MFA delete to help protect objects from accidental or unauthorized deletion. It should be noted that MFA Delete can only be configured on buckets that have versioning enabled.

s3-bucket-no-versioning.rationale: Versioning is a means of keeping multiple variants of an object in the same bucket. With versioning, you can easily recover from both unintended user actions and application failures.

s3-bucket-world-Delete-policy.description: Delete Actions Authorized to All Principals
s3-bucket-world-Delete-policy.rationale: Allowing IAM actions to all principals is contrary to the principle of least privilege and presents an opportunity for abuse. This policy should be reviewed to ensure it is secure and in line with the resource's intended use.

s3-bucket-world-Get-policy.description: Get Actions Authorized to All Principals
s3-bucket-world-Get-policy.rationale: Allowing IAM actions to all principals is contrary to the principle of least privilege and presents an opportunity for abuse. This policy should be reviewed to ensure it is secure and in line with the resource's intended use.

s3-bucket-world-List-policy.description: List Actions Authorized to All Principals
s3-bucket-world-List-policy.rationale: Allowing IAM actions to all principals is contrary to the principle of least privilege and presents an opportunity for abuse. This policy should be reviewed to ensure it is secure and in line with the resource's intended use.

s3-bucket-world-Put-policy.description: Put Actions Authorized to All Principals
s3-bucket-world-Put-policy.rationale: Allowing IAM actions to all principals is contrary to the principle of least privilege and presents an opportunity for abuse. This policy should be reviewed to ensure it is secure and in line with the resource's intended use.

s3-bucket-world-policy-star.description: All Actions Authorized to All Principals
s3-bucket-world-policy-star.rationale: Allowing IAM actions to all principals is contrary to the principle of least privilege and presents an opportunity for abuse. This policy should be reviewed to ensure it is secure and in line with the resource's intended use.
s3-bucket-world-policy-star.remediation: Remove any Statement having an Effect set to Allow and a Principal set to "*" or {"AWS":"*"} in the affected bucket policy

ses-identity-dkim-not-enabled.rationale: DKIM signing is not enabled for emails sent from the identity.

ses-identity-dkim-not-verified.rationale: Amazon SES has not verified the DKIM DNS records (tokens) published in the domain name's DNS.

ses-identity-world-SendEmail-policy.rationale: Allowing IAM actions to all principals is contrary to the principle of least privilege and presents an opportunity for abuse. This policy should be reviewed to ensure it is secure and in line with the resource's intended use.

ses-identity-world-SendRawEmail-policy.rationale: Allowing IAM actions to all principals is contrary to the principle of least privilege and presents an opportunity for abuse. This policy should be reviewed to ensure it is secure and in line with the resource's intended use.

sns-topic-world-AddPermission-policy.rationale: Allowing IAM actions to all principals is contrary to the principle of least privilege and presents an opportunity for abuse. This policy should be reviewed to ensure it is secure and in line with the resource's intended use.

sns-topic-world-DeleteTopic-policy.rationale: Allowing IAM actions to all principals is contrary to the principle of least privilege and presents an opportunity for abuse. This policy should be reviewed to ensure it is secure and in line with the resource's intended use.

sns-topic-world-GetTopicAttributes-polic.rationale: Allowing IAM actions to all principals is contrary to the principle of least privilege and presents an opportunity for abuse. This policy should be reviewed to ensure it is secure and in line with the resource's intended use.

sns-topic-world-ListSubscriptionsByTopic.rationale: Allowing IAM actions to all principals is contrary to the principle of least privilege and presents an opportunity for abuse. This policy should be reviewed to ensure it is secure and in line with the resource's intended use.

sns-topic-world-Publish-policy.rationale: Allowing IAM actions to all principals is contrary to the principle of least privilege and presents an opportunity for abuse. This policy should be reviewed to ensure it is secure and in line with the resource's intended use.

sns-topic-world-RemovePermission-policy.rationale: Allowing IAM actions to all principals is contrary to the principle of least privilege and presents an opportunity for abuse. This policy should be reviewed to ensure it is secure and in line with the resource's intended use.

sns-topic-world-SetTopicAttributes-polic.rationale: Allowing IAM actions to all principals is contrary to the principle of least privilege and presents an opportunity for abuse. This policy should be reviewed to ensure it is secure and in line with the resource's intended use.

sns-topic-world-Subscribe-policy.rationale: Allowing IAM actions to all principals is contrary to the principle of least privilege and presents an opportunity for abuse. This policy should be reviewed to ensure it is secure and in line with the resource's intended use.

sqs-queue-server-side-encryption-disable.rationale: SQS Server-Side Encryption ensures that the contents of messages in queues are encrypted.

sqs-queue-world-ChangeMessageVisibility-.rationale: Allowing IAM actions to all principals is contrary to the principle of least privilege and presents an opportunity for abuse. This policy should be reviewed to ensure it is secure and in line with the resource's intended use.

sqs-queue-world-DeleteMessage-policy.rationale: Allowing IAM actions to all principals is contrary to the principle of least privilege and presents an opportunity for abuse. This policy should be reviewed to ensure it is secure and in line with the resource's intended use.

sqs-queue-world-GetQueueAttributes-polic.rationale: Allowing IAM actions to all principals is contrary to the principle of least privilege and presents an opportunity for abuse. This policy should be reviewed to ensure it is secure and in line with the resource's intended use.

sqs-queue-world-GetQueueUrl-policy.rationale: Allowing IAM actions to all principals is contrary to the principle of least privilege and presents an opportunity for abuse. This policy should be reviewed to ensure it is secure and in line with the resource's intended use.

sqs-queue-world-PurgeQueue-policy.rationale: Allowing IAM actions to all principals is contrary to the principle of least privilege and presents an opportunity for abuse. This policy should be reviewed to ensure it is secure and in line with the resource's intended use.

sqs-queue-world-ReceiveMessage-policy.rationale: Allowing IAM actions to all principals is contrary to the principle of least privilege and presents an opportunity for abuse. This policy should be reviewed to ensure it is secure and in line with the resource's intended use.

sqs-queue-world-SendMessage-policy.rationale: Allowing IAM actions to all principals is contrary to the principle of least privilege and presents an opportunity for abuse. This policy should be reviewed to ensure it is secure and in line with the resource's intended use.

vpc-custom-network-acls-allow-all-egress.description: Network ACLs Allow All egress Traffic (custom)
vpc-custom-network-acls-allow-all-egress.rationale: Network ACLs are designed to provide a secondary layer of security. Adding a rule that allows all network traffic (all protocols, IPs, and destination) prior to any deny rule defeats the purpose of network ACLs.

vpc-custom-network-acls-allow-all-ingres.description: Network ACLs Allow All ingress Traffic (custom)
vpc-custom-network-acls-allow-all-ingres.rationale: Network ACLs are designed to provide a secondary layer of security. Adding a rule that allows all network traffic (all protocols, IPs, and source) prior to any deny rule defeats the purpose of network ACLs.

vpc-default-network-acls-allow-all-egres.description: Network ACLs Allow All egress Traffic (default)
vpc-default-network-acls-allow-all-egres.rationale: Network ACLs are designed to provide a secondary layer of security. Adding a rule that allows all network traffic (all protocols, IPs, and destination) prior to any deny rule defeats the purpose of network ACLs.

vpc-default-network-acls-allow-all-ingre.description: Network ACLs Allow All ingress Traffic (default)
vpc-default-network-acls-allow-all-ingre.rationale: Network ACLs are designed to provide a secondary layer of security. Adding a rule that allows all network traffic (all protocols, IPs, and source) prior to any deny rule defeats the purpose of network ACLs.

vpc-network-acl-not-used.rationale: Maintaining unused resources increases risks of misconfigurations and increases the difficulty of audits.

vpc-routing-tables-with-peering.rationale: Being highly selective in peering routing tables minimizes the impact of breach as resources outside of these routes are inaccessible to the peered VPC.
vpc-routing-tables-with-peering.remediation: Ensure route tables contain the least number of subnets or hosts as is required to accomplish the purpose for peering

vpc-subnet-with-allow-all-egress-acls.rationale: Network ACLs associated with subnets and VPCs should not allow all egress traffic.

vpc-subnet-with-allow-all-ingress-acls.rationale: Network ACLs associated with subnets and VPCs should not allow all ingress traffic.

vpc-subnet-without-flow-log.rationale: Flow logs enable the investigation of incidents involving unauthorized network traffic, such as an attacker exfiltrating data or pivoting to other hosts.
vpc-subnet-without-flow-log.remediation: Create a flow log for each subnet.
